Aristotle Pagaltzis wrote:
> 
> 
> * Eric J. Bowman <eric@... 
> <mailto:eric%40bisonsystems.net>> [2008-03-30 09:05]:
>  > My question for the group, is whether it's even valid to issue
>  > a redirect for DELETE when GET, HEAD, PUT and perhaps OPTIONS
>  > would respond 200 OK for the same resource. Does this violate
>  > the uniform interface constraint, or the self-descriptive
>  > message constraint? Or, no big deal?
> 
> I donâ€™t see any problem with it.
> 
> However, I also see no problem with your proposal to use 202 to
> return a document requesting confirmation as long as the eventual
> deletion is done using DELETE. 

Aristotle, I think 202 isn't right here. It would mean the request is 
accepted, but to be done later on, not that it requires further 
intervention.

There isn't a good mapping for this. 403 Forbidden (which I've seen used 
for terms and conditions) comes to mind as an option, or maybe 409 with 
instructions.

Bill
